intro: Cynoglossum hellwigii, commonly known as the narrowleaf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its hairy stems and showy flowers. Cynoglossum hellwigii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
